abstract:
<jats:p>We describe a new species in the genus <jats:italic>Voria</jats:italic> Robineau-Desvoidy, 1830 (Diptera: Tachinidae: Voriini) from Area de Conservación Guanacaste (ACG) in northwestern Costa Rica. It was reared as part of an ongoing inventory of wild-caught caterpillars spanning a variety of moth and butterfly families (Lepidoptera). Our study provides a concise description of the new species using morphology, life history, molecular data, and photographic documentation. In addition to the new species, we provide a diagnosis of the genus as well as new data relating to host use.</jats:p>
          <jats:p>The following new species of <jats:italic>Voria</jats:italic> is described: <jats:italic>Voria</jats:italic> <jats:italic>erasmocoronadoi</jats:italic> Fleming & Wood <jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold></jats:p>
          <jats:p>The following are proposed by Fleming & Wood as new synonyms of <jats:italic>Voria</jats:italic>: <jats:italic>Xenoplagia</jats:italic> Townsend, 1914 <jats:bold>syn. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Hystricovoria</jats:italic> Townsend, 1928 <jats:bold>syn. n.</jats:bold>, <jats:italic>Afrovoria</jats:italic> Curran, 1938 <jats:bold>syn. n.</jats:bold>, and <jats:italic>Anavoria</jats:italic> Mesnil, 1953 <jats:bold>syn. n.</jats:bold>, and <jats:italic>Itavoria</jats:italic> Townsend, 1931 <jats:bold>syn. n.</jats:bold></jats:p>
          <jats:p>The following new combinations are proposed as a result of the new synonymies: <jats:italic>Voria bakeri</jats:italic> (Townsend, 1928), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold> and <jats:italic>Voria setosa</jats:italic> (Townsend, 1914), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold><jats:bold> </jats:bold>The authors also propose <jats:italic>Voria pollyclari</jats:italic> (Rocha-e-Silva, Lopes & Della Lucia, 1999), <jats:bold>comb. n.</jats:bold> based on the morphology of the holotype.</jats:p>
title: A new species of Voria Robineau-Desvoidy (Diptera: Tachinidae) from Area de Conservación Guanacaste in northwestern Costa Rica
